column2: ENGLISH
Biography of Alustriel

Alustriel was a powerful mage, being one of the Chosen of Mystra and one of the Seven Sisters. She was known for her love and devotion to her people, something especially unusual for many people who hold political power. Therefore, she was extremely popular in Silverymoon, and most of her subjects would do anything in their power to prevent any harm from happening to her. She was considered a wise and fair ruler, but did hesitate to be ruthless when needed.
Biography of Bruenor

Bruenor was a powerful shield dwarf with flaming red hair, famous for reclaiming Mithril Hall for Clan Battlehammer. He was considered a bit odd for a dwarf for the company he kept — his 2 adopted human children, Wulfgar and Catti-brie, and the drow ranger Drizzt and the halfling thief Regis.
Biography of Drizzt

Born and raised in the cruel drow city of Menzoberranzan, Drizzt escaped and became a wanderer on the surface world. He became possibly the most famous adventurer in the Realms, his heroic exploits too many to count.
Biography of Bhaal
Once a human adventurer who bested primordials and gods, Bhaal became god of murder. Despite his rise to godhood, a dark shadow lay over his future, prompting him to lay far-reaching plans.
Bhaalspawn

Progeny of the God of Murder, there is a darkness and will-to-power in the souls of these powerful individuals. Some overcome their dark natures and fight for good, but most of them end up succumbing and bringing misery to the lands of their birth.
Biography of Sarevok

A powerful Bhaalspawn who gave in to his dark nature. Sarevok sought to kill all his siblings and absorb their power, in addition to spreading murder and death all across the Sword Coast before his planned ascension to godhood.
Biography of Sarya

Countess Sarya Dlardrageth was a half sun elf, half-fiend sorceress, leader of the daemonfey and a princess of House Dlardrageth. Imprisoned along with her kin for centuries, she sought freedom and the restoration of the ancient power of her House.
Biography of the Coral Princess
The Coral Princess was a rare albino yikarian, who showed comparative liberalism in being willing to trade with outsiders rather than enslave them on sight.
Biography of Khelben

Born nameless due to rejection by his elven relatives, Khelben had many names over the years as he rose to become Mystra's Chosen and one of Faerûn's most famed archmages. He had a particular interest in the Sword Coast, and returned to live there often.
Biography of Khelben Ravencloak
Khelben 'Ravencloak' Arunsun was an enigmatic planeswalker and wizard, the grandson of the famous Khelben Blackstaff, whom he closely resembled.
Biography of Laeral

Laeral was a powerful mage, one of the Seven Sisters and a Chosen of Mystra. She was something of an enigma to the people of Waterdeep, having moved to Blackstaff Tower as Khelben's consort after he freed her from a terrible curse.
Biography of the Pereghost

The Pereghost was one of the great mysteries of the Zhentarim's fortress of Darkhold. The warrior appeared out of nowhere in 1356 DR, offering his services to the Black Network. He gave no name other than "The Pereghost" and refused to speak of his history. Within three years he was given command of the keep's entire army.
Biography of Piergeiron

Piergeiron 'the Paladinson' was a loyal paladin of Tyr. Behind his back, he's sometimes called 'the Thickskull', on account of his stolid and impassive demeanour. However, he had be doing something right, as his governance of Waterdeep over many years testified.
Biography of Renwick Caradoon

Renwick Caradoon was a great Waterdhavian wizard of old, the brother of the great paladins Amphail and Samular. Renwick long outlived his brothers, kept in an unusual form of undeath by the power of positive energies.
Biography of Amelyssan

Amelyssan 'the Blackhearted' was a priestess and Deathstalker of Bhaal, the God of Murder, whom that deity entrusted with the task of resurrecting him. However, her own goal was ultimately to gather all the power of Bhaal's essence released from his children into herself and become a goddess.
Biography of Obould

Obould Many-Arrows was an orcish war-leader of exceptional vigour, patience and insight. He was determined to raise the orcs of the North to the status of a true nation, with the proper respect and diplomatic recognition that the so-called civilised races showed to one another. Why in the name of Gruumsh, he asked, should orcs get any less?
Biography of Elminster

Elminster Aumar gave up the chance to become King of Athalantar, and instead serve the goddess Mystra as an itinerant sage and wizard. His powers were many, but his erratic manner and tendency to be elsewhere at crucial moments left many with a mixed opinion of him.
Biography of Grypht
Grypht was a minor tribal chief of the saurials on another world, who was brought to Toril by the magic of the evil god Moander.
Biography of Dragonbait
Dragonbait was a paladin of one of the saurials' own gods on their alien homeworld. He adopted the Thorass nickname 'dragonbait' from his companion Alias.
Biography of Cassana
Cassana was a powerful sorceress from the Dragon Coast who made alliances with many powerful beings to advance her own private agendas.
Biography of Alias
Alias was a synthetic clone of Cassana of Westgate, given life by a consortium of powerful beings including the nascent demigod Finder Wyvernspur.
Biography of the Simbul

The Simbul was one of the Seven Sisters. She was one of the most powerful spellcasters in the Realms and is well known for her unpredictable rage, sudden outbursts, and being the lover of Elminster. After assuming the throne of Aglarond, she became known as the Witch-Queen of Aglarond.
Biography of Storm Silverhand

Storm Silverhand, called "the Bard of Shadowdale" was one of the Seven Sisters. Though she has a reputation for flightiness, she was well loved in her home of Shadowdale and the rest of Faerûn. She earned her name when, as a toddler, she demonstrated an immunity to naturally occuring lightning.
Biography of Manshoon

Manshoon was the founder of the Zhentarim, also known as the Black Network. Completely fitting the archetype of the sly-tongued, sinister and decadent master spellcaster, he was arrogant, untouchable in his power and faintly amused by it all. Manshoon became notorious for habitually creating clones of himself... is this character the original Manshoon, or a clone?
Biography of Fzoul Chembryl

Fzoul Chembryl, the ambitious High Priest of Bane, joined the Zhentarim when Lord Manshoon forged an alliance with him. He served as second-in-command for years, seemingly content with his position, while secretly scheming for leadership.
Biography of Shuruppak
Shuruppak was once an assassin, the enforcer of Gilgeam's will and law. Known as "the Reaper", he wandered among the cities of Unther, killing anyone he identified as an enemy of Gilgeam.
Biography of Doric
The tiefling Doric was taken in by a wood elf enclave in Neverwinter Wood after being abandoned as a child, and she grew to guard her adoptive community with nature's ferocity.
Biography of Edgin
Edgin Darvis had a talent for improvisation and strategy. He was a musician and tale-teller who relied on charisma first — rather than magic or muscle — to escape trouble.
Biography of Forge

Forge Fitzwilliam was a con artist who manipulated others with lies and flattery. This audacious criminal left a trail of broken promises and false identities along the Sword Coast. He concealed flexible morals and a ready dagger behind his winning smile.
Biography of Holga

Holga Kilgore was a member of the Uthgardt Elk Tribe, and her strength and scowl concealed a generous heart. She was a woman of few words who let her actions - and punches - speak for her. A fearsome combatant when her ire was roused, Holga wielded anything that came to hand — from weapons to snacks.
Biography of Simon

Simon Aumar suffered under the weight of his family name. Though he was a descendent of an elf and of the legendary wizard Elminster Aumar, Simon's own sorcerous wild magic ran uncontrolled through his veins.
Biography of Sofina
Sofina was a Red Wizard of Thay, an elite practitioner of magic with ties to Thay's tyrannical magocracy. Sofina specialised in necromancy. Death magic and fear were crucial tools in her arsenal.
Biography of Xenk
Raised in the nation of Thay, Xenk Yendar swore an oath of devotion to aid the innocent. Every inch the knight in shining armor, he thrived when inspiring goodness in his allies.
Biography of Themberchaud

Themberchaud was a massive red dragon who became known as the Wyrmsmith of Gracklstugh for his work with the duergar of that subterranean city. But with time, he started to become ambitious, and sought a new home.
Biography of Astarion
Astarion was turned into a vampire spawn by a cruel master ages ago, and set to hunt for his creator's pleasure. This treatment affected his whole being, and he longed to escape this control.
Biography of Gale

Gale was a wizard in Waterdeep who had an intimate relationship with the goddess Mystra. Her volatile passions inspired him, and he was regarded as a rising star of the Art. But her fickleness led him to take a terrifying risk.
Biography of Lae'zel

Lae'zel was a githyanki warrior from a crèche on an asteroid in the Tears of Selûne, raised to serve the lich-queen Vlaakith CLVII. Brought to Faerûn on a special mission, she encountered many challenges to her martial world-view.
Biography of Shadowheart

As a keen devotee of the dark goddess Shar, the priestess known as Shadowheart was raised from childhood to serve the whims of the Mother Superior. Sent on a quest with no memory of why she had been chosen, she was forced to reckon with strange truths.
Biography of Wyll

The son and heir of Ulder Ravengard, Grand Duke of Baldur's Gate, Wyll had the world before him. When his selfless heroics led him to make a terrible bargain, he found himself at odds with his renowned father.
Biography of Karlach
Karlach was a mighty barbarian, serving as a bodyguard to rich patriars in Baldur's Gate. But her prowess in combat made her valuable to people she would much rather never have encountered.
Biography of Jenevelle

Jenevelle Hallowleaf was kidnapped from her family at a young age and indoctrinated by the cult of Shar. When she finally regained her memories, she renounced the Lady of Loss and returned to her parents' Selûnite faith.
Biography of the Dark Urge
The mysterious killer known as the Dark Urge first appeared in Baldur's Gate in 1477DR, leaving behind a trail of mayhem. Some say the Dark Urge's bloodlust stemmed from a terrible divine legacy.
Biography of Minsc

The eccentric ranger Minsc was raised in the Rashemi warrior tradition, and prepared to accompany one of his nation's witches on a 'dajemma', a ritual period of wandering abroad. He was accompanied by his pet Boo, whom he described as miniature giant space hamster.
Biography of Orin

Orin was born of an incestuous relationship between the fallen Bhaalspawn Sarevok and his daughter Helena. A devotee of her grandfather, the god Bhaal, she was notorious for her erratic and bloodthirsty behaviour.
Biography of Abdel

Abdel Adrian was raised at Candlekeep, the foster-son of the renowned sage Gorion. But his true origins were more sinister, as he was in fact one of the Bhaalspawn, the secret children of the Lord of Murder.
Biography of Jaheira

Jaheira was born into a noble family in Tethyr. Her parents were killed during the mob violence of the Ten Black Days of Eleint, and Jaheira was rescued by one of their servants and adopted by druids. She learned the druids' path, and became a member of their order.
Biography of Nocturne

Nocturne was an orphaned tiefling in Baldur's Gate, who was taken in by the clergy of Shar, the Lady of Loss. She rose to become a trusted member of the temple staff, but it was one of her young fellow-initiates who gave her the support she needed in difficult times.
Biography of Imoen

Imoen was raised in seclusion at Candlekeep, away from the turmoil of Faerûn beyond. But when she ventured out to help a foster-sibling, she discovered her own heritage as a daughter of Bhaal, the god of Murder.
Biography of Viconia

Viconia deVir was born to a powerful noble family in Menzoberranzan. But when her mother, Matron of their house, demanded that she sacrifice a baby of Lolth the Spider Queen, Viconia rebelled. She fled the City of Spiders and made her way to the Sword Coast, where she converted to the worship of Shar, goddess of the night.
Biography of Xan

Xan was a wizard from the elven nation of Evereska. Perpetually sombre and pessimistic, he was nevertheless blessed by Corellon Larethian, gaining both a sacred moonblade and the Protector's boon of gender fluidity.
Biography of Mazzy
Mazzy Fentan came from the town of Trademeet, on the disputed border between Amn and Tethyr. A devoted follower of the goddess Arvoreen, Mazzy was a pioneer of paladinhood for halflings.
Biography of Aerie

Kidnapped from her village as a young elf by slavers, Aerie lost her wings to disease while in captivity. She turned from the worship of Aerdrie Faenya to worship the gnomish god Baervan Wildwanderer instead.
Biography of Ajantis
Ajantis was a scion of the noble Ilvastarr family of Waterdeep. He trained under the mighty Myrmith Splendon, before joining the Order of the Radiant Heart as a squire paladin.
Biography of Alora

Alora was a halfling from Iriaebor who constantly sought to explore any place she had been told she could not go. She affected the manner of a human child when speaking to strangers, but this concealed a cunning mind.
Biography of Anomen
Anomen was a member of the distinguished Delryn family of Athkatla. He was sponsored by the Church of Helm to join the Order of the Radiant Heart as a warrior cleric.
Biography of Aylin

Dame Aylin was the daughter of the goddess Selûne the Moonmaiden, and one of the mightiest aasimar in Faerûn. She was frequently sought by those who wish to exploit her power for their own ends, but she maintained her independence whenever possible.
Biography of Baeloth
Baeloth Barrityl was an independent drow male who established himself as the proprietor of a fighting area in the Underdark known as the Black Pits.
Biography of Balthazar
Balthazar was a necromancer and devotee of Myrkul, the Lord of Bones. He worked closely with General Ketheric Thorm to establish control over a portion of the Western Heartlands.
Biography of Bodhi

Bodhi was an elf in Suldanessellar, in the forests of Wealdath, whose uninhibited lust for power led her to violate social and magical boundaries. Along with her brother Jon, she was exiled from her homeland for her crimes.
Biography of Branwen
Branwen came from Seawolf, in the Norheim Isles, and left home to travel the world as a priest of Tempus, God of Battles.
Biography of Cernd
Cernd was a druid from Amn who lived in Athkatla for a time. He was noted for his introspection and careful contemplation.
Biography of Clara
Clara grew up in rural Amn and moved to Athkatla to seek her fortune as an actress. She met with limited success, and also worked as a courtesan and latterly as a thief.
Biography of Coran

Originally from Wealdath, Coran took to the road as a travelling adventurer in search of fortune and romance. His flamboyant manner and seemingly careless attitude led some to overlook his sharp wits and excellent memory.
Biography of Caladorn

Caladorn Cassalanter was the heir of a wealthy noble family in Waterdeep. Believing that he should prove himself worthy of the privilege he inherited, he distanced himself from his family for a time to travel as an adventurer, during which he discovered his affinity for ships and the sea.
Biography of Dorn Il-Khan

Dorn Il-Khan was born to a human woman enslaved by orcs in the Spine of the World mountains. As soon as he could leave home, he moved to the Luskan area to operate as a bandit. When his gang betrayed him, he accepted an offer of mystical power in order to strike out on his own.
Biography of Dynaheir

Dynaheir was a young invoker from the wychlaran tradition of Rashemen. She set out for the Sword Coast with her bodyguard as part of a rite of passage known as a dajemma in which they would both see the world.
Biography of Edwin

Edwin Odesseiron was an ambitious junior member of a distinguished Thayan family which had produced many Red Wizards. He came to the Sword Coast seeking to raise his standing by tracking down magical lore and wanted fugitives.
Biography of Eldoth
Eldoth Kron was a wandering bard from Ruathym who made a rough living seducing rich noblewomen. He was casually dishonest about both his intentions and the details of his past exploits.
Biography of Enver

Enver Gortash was born to a poor family in Baldur's Gate, and his parents sold him to a warlock to pay a debt. He escaped captivity and became an inspired magical engineer and an aspiring politician, but many who dealt with him were scared by his capacity for hate and grudges.
Biography of Faldorn

Faldorn was originally from the Black Raven Uthgardt tribe, but she was given away as a child to be raised by druids. She combined a calm and relaxed manner with radical religious and political views on the role of druids.
Biography of Ammon

Ammon Jerro was a member of a noble house in Neverwinter. He studied many arcane topics, and became one of the few human experts on the gith cultures. He was also well versed in the magics of ancient Illefarn, and sought ruthlessly to suppress the resurgence of their worst excesses.
Biography of Aribeth
Aribeth de Tylmarande was a passionate half-elf paladin from the village of Thundertree. She rose high in the service of Neverwinter and its lord, Nasher Alagondar.
Biography of Boddyknock
Boddyknock Glinkle was gnomish sorcerer from Lantan. Unlike many other Lantanese, he was primarily a magical researcher rather than an inventor.
Biography of Daelan
Daelan was a half-orc barbarian born into the Red Tiger Uthgardt tribe. His own people shunned him because of his orcish heritage, and so he sought to prove his worth as an adventurer.
Biography of Deekin

Deekin Scalesinger was a member of the Dripping Fang kobold clan who served the white dragon Tymofarrar. The dragon groomed Deekin as a potential chief, but Deekin rejected a life of politics and set out to become a respected skald instead.
Biography of Desther
Desther Indelayne was regarded as an experienced and upstanding cleric of Helm. He was based at Helm's Hold, but was a frequent visitor to Neverwinter.
Biography of Fenthick
Fenthick Moss was a cleric of Tyr in Neverwinter. He worked closely with the Helmites of Helm's Hold, and was respected as a trustworthy man.
Biography of Garrick
Garrick was a bard who trained in Berdusk before touring Amn and the Sword Coast. He was noted for his romantic aspirations and trusting nature.
Biography of Glint
Glint Gardnersonson was a gnomish cleric of Baravar Cloakshadow from Baldur's Gate. Constantly curious, he travelled to Waterdeep and around the Sword Coast in search of his many distant relatives.
Biography of Grimgnaw

Grimgnaw Battlehammer was a dwarf who studied the monastic path of the Long Death, dedicated to the service of death itself rather than any specific deity. He became an expert in death and in means of causing it, to the extent of a highly morbid fascination.
Biography of Haer'Dalis

Haer'Dalis was a tiefling actor from the planar metropolis of Sigil, and a member of the Doomguard faction, which regarded entropic decay as the true purpose of the multiverse. He was imprisoned after performing a play which offended the leader of a rival faction.
Biography of Sharwyn
Sharwyn was a bard from Neverwinter, who set out to find songs and stories that perfectly expressed deep emotional truths.
Biography of Skie
Skie Silvershield was the daughter of Duke Entar Silvershield, head of a renowned patriar family from Baldur's Gate. Learned and dextrous, she longed to become a hero like her father.
Biography of Tiax

Tiax was an ambitious gnome from Baldur's Gate who converted to the worship of Cyric the Black Sun in the wake of the Time of Troubles. He preached the word of Cyric despite knowing its flaws and contradictions, as he viewed it as a path to greater personal power.
Biography of Tomi

Tomi 'Grin' Undergallows was a halfling from Calimshan who fled his homeland after being accused of many crimes. He travelled as far north as Neverwinter in search of a fortune, but continued to attract the attention of the authorities for his misdeeds.
Biography of Ulder

Ulder Ravengard was the son of a humble blacksmith in Baldur's Gate. Joining the Flaming Fist at a young age, he eventually rose to high rank in the city through years of dedicated service and loyalty.
Biography of Valen

Valen Shadowbreath was a street-child in the planar metropolis of Sigil before being enslaved by a demon to fight in the Blood War. He eventually escaped captivity and made his way to Toril where he fought to help others receive their freedom too.
Biography of Valygar

Valygar Corthala was the heir of a noble family of wizards in Amn. His parents both became undead through their use of magic, which Valygar viewed as an abomination. He defeated his parents, and dedicated himself to opposing the excesses of magic.
Biography of Voghiln

Voghiln was a warrior-skald from Luskan who loved carousing and seeking out the company of women. He turned to frequent excessive drinking after becoming the only survivor of his first adventuring group.
Biography of Xanos
Xanos Messarmos was a studious half-orc sorcerer from Chessenta. He was determined to become a great leader, and sought out specialised arcane tuition to hone his skills.
Biography of Xzar

Xzar was a callous and reckless necromancer who was reputed by many to be irretrievably insane. He rarely made friends, and dedicated most of his energies to seeking paths to immortality, or working for people who would fund this quest.
Biography of Xzar

The Chaos Clone was created by the necromancer Xzar from his own flesh before he embarked on the final steps towards lichdom. After his original undead body crumbled, the clone became animated, but his soul did not possess it. The clone body wandered Faerûn, spreading havoc and imitating its creator's acts in life.
Biography of Yeslick
Yeslick Orothiar was one of the few survivors of his clan after many of them died in a mining disaster. He became a priest of Clangeddin Silverbeard, the Morndinsamman god of warfare.
Biography of Yoshimo

Yoshimo was a travelling bounty hunter who was originally from Kara-Tur. He came to venerate the Faerûnian god Ilmater, the Crying God. While on the Sword Coast, Yoshimo took on many jobs, and made a number of enemies by his exploits.
Biography of Zariel

Zariel was originally a solar aasimon in the service of Lathander the Morninglord. After leading a fateful attack on the Nine Hells, she turned to the service of the baatezu and rose to great power among them through her unbridled hatred of the tanar'ri.
Biography of Azoun
Azoun Obarskyr, fourth of that name, was renowned in his youth for his amorous adventures, but matured into a warrior who was widely respected as a leader of his people.
Biography of Vajra

Vajra Safahr was born into a distinguished family in Tethyr, and possessed an innate sorcerous talent. After her father died saving Queen Cyriana from assassins, she devoted herself to wizardry. After studying with the Tethyrian court vizeras for a time, she moved to Waterdeep to work with the Blackstaff.
Biography of Bel

Bel, the Risen General, was an archdevil who ruled Avernus, the First Hell, for many years. A skilled strategist, he excelled in logistics and long-term planning in the endless Blood War against the tanar'ri.
Biography of Demogorgon

Demogorgon was a fierce tanar'ri lord personifying domination and the draining of energy. He called himself the Prince of Demons, and none had been able to wrest this title from him. His two heads, Aameul and Hethradiah, had different personalities and competing objectives.
Biography of Orcus

Orcus, the Prince of Undeath, was a demon lord from the Abyss, and rumoured to have originated as a primordial. He loathed all other living things, and sought to reduce the multiverse to a blasted realm of the dead.
Biography of Anthraxus

Anthraxus was a powerful yugoloth, raised to greater might by the powers of the night hags. For many centuries he was the ruler of Khin-Oin, the Wasting Tower of Oinos in the Grey Waste, and commander of the innumerable diseases of that place.
Biography of Yeenoghu

Yeenoghu, the Prince of Gnolls, was a demon lord who epitomised bloodshed and untrammelled devastation. He was especially venerated by gnolls, and had effectively displaced their traditional god Gorellik to become their main deity.
Biography of Graz'zt
Graz'zt was a demon lord who personified self-indulgence and sensual pleasure. Beautiful and sophisticated, he was also a tyrant whose Abyssal realm was said to be the largest of any demon.
Biography of Malcanthet

Malcanthet, Queen of the Succubi, defeated several other powerful succubi to secure her title. As a demon lord, she excelled at both political and sexual seduction, and served as the demon lords' greatest ambassador when enough of them could agree on a mission.
Biography of Halaster

Halaster Blackcloak was the proverbial 'Mad Mage' who created the dungeon of Undermountain after slaughtering the drow and other creatures who occupied Mount Melairbode. A wizard of great power and ingenuity, he sought to attract adventurers to his home for his own twisted purposes.
Biography of Durnan

Durnan the Wanderer came originally from the far north of Faerûn. He adventured with Mirt the Moneylender for a time, and the two emerged from Undermountain as wealthy men. Durnan established the Yawning Portal Inn over the dungeon's main entrance, and retired to run the place.
Biography of Kyriani

In her early life, Kyriani Agrivar was magically divided into two beings, the half-elf Cybriana and the drow Kilili. The two reunited in early adulthood, creating Kyriani. She went on to have a distinguished career in the magical arts.
Biography of Sememmon

Sememmon was a scholarly wizard and a ruthless politician, who rose to high office in the Zhentarim during the early days of the Black Network. He was a subtle man who rarely revealed his true thoughts or intentions until well after he had acted.
Biography of Halsin

Halsin befriended a nature spirit when he was a child, and on reaching his majority, became a druid of the Circle of the Moon. He survived being enslaved by a drow matron, and remained committed to nature, and natural pleasures.
Biography of Hexxat
Hexxat was raised in the Chultan city of Mezro by her aunts. As an adult, she became the agent of a mysterious benefactor who wished to intervene in matters relating to the undead.
Biography of Isobel
Isobel was the only child of General Ketheric Thorm, and a devoted follower of Selûne. She joined the Moonmaiden's clergy, and dedicated her life to spreading her light.
Biography of Jan
Jan Janssen was a poor gnomish inventor who sold turnips in the slums of Athkatla. He was fond of his extensive family, and sought to improve their situation by selling his inventions to adventurers.
Biography of Joneleth

Joneleth 'Jon' Irenicus was an elven wizard who was driven out of Suldanessellar for trying to absorb the power of the sacred Tree of Life. He went on to seek many other corrupt paths to great arcane power and immortality.
Biography of Kagain
Kagain was a dwarven merchant and mercenary who lived in Beregost. He was a greedy and cynical man whose disdain for the lives of others grew with time into outright cruelty.
Biography of Kagha

Kagha was an ambitious young druid who followed the teachings of Faldorn. She expressed a particular keenness to restore her vision of the sanctity of the druidic groves in the face of outside influences.
Biography of Keldorn

Sir Keldorn Firecam was a paladin of Torm in the Order of the Radiant Heart. Early in his career a brother knight betrayed him into the hands of vicious ogres, but he was able to escape and rescue his comrades from them.
Biography of Ketheric
General Ketheric Thorm was once a follower of Selûne. But he gave in to despair after a series of personal tragedies, and turned to the worship of crueller gods as he sought to shut out his pain.
Biography of Khalid
Khalid was the least-favoured son of a noble family in Calimshan. To escape their scorn, he threw himself into a career as a warrior, and left home to develop his skill and do good in the world.
Biography of Korgan

The mercenary Korgan Bloodaxe was orphaned at a young age, and worked hard to establish himself. He had a crude sense of humour, and a talent for terse, expressive poetry, along with the ruthlessness necessary to get ahead as a sellsword in Amn.
Biography of Krydle

Krydle was the son of the politician and retired adventurer Coran, who had become a respected figure in Baldur's Gate. Krydle often disagreed with his father, and found solidarity among the city's criminal underworld in the face of the inequality that he hated.
Biography of Linu

Linu La'neral was an elven cleric from Evereska. She was dedicated to Sehanine Moonbow, goddess of death, dreams, and travel. Despite several setbacks in her life, she maintained a positive view of the world and held onto hope as much as possible.
Biography of Mephistopheles

Mephistopheles was the ruler of Cania, the Eighth Hell. He was reputed to be the greatest wizard of all the baatezu, and the creator of Hellfire itself. Although he maintained a cool demeanour much of the time, his pride often got the better of him and led him to lash out at those around him.
Biography of Minthara

Minthara was born into House Baenre, the ruling house of the drow city of Menzoberranzan. An encounter with two zealous religious missionaries inspired her to visit the upper world, and set her on the path to a remarkable conversion.
Biography of Mizora
Mizora was a half-devil cambion in the service of Zariel, the Archduchess of Avernus. A skilled negotiator, she became a warlock patron adept at controlling the fates of her devotees.
Biography of M'Khiin
M'Khiin Grubdoubler was a goblin shaman. Her spiritual discipline made her valuable to her clan, but also led her to tire of their brutality, until she eventually escaped.
Biography of Montaron

Montaron was a mercenary agent who travelled the Western Heartlands on business. A cynical and selfish halfling, he lived a mostly nocturnal life and preferred to spend his time in cities when he could.
Biography of Nalia
Nalia de'Arnise was an Amnian noblewoman whose charitable nature led her to fight for the rights of all those less well off than herself.
Biography of Nasher
Nasher Alagondar became Lord of Neverwinter after a short but dramatic career as an adventurer. Famed for his skill at arms, he was a strong fighter and a sincere follower of Tyr.
Biography of Neera

Neera was a half-elf from Highbough in the High Forest. She manifested wild magic powers early in life, and was exiled from the forest by the treant Turlang for starting fires. After that, she was often on the run.
Biography of Quayle

Quayle was a gnomish illusionist and priest of Baravar Cloakshadow. Short-tempered and convinced of his own brilliance, Quayle was often short of friends, but showed occasional moments of deep compassion.
Biography of Raphael

Raphael was a charismatic and determined cambion, who delighted in convincing mortals to make disadvantageous contracts with him. Despite his great personal power, Raphael was never satisfied, and was always searching for artefacts to give him an edge over other devils, and even his father.
Biography of Rasaad
Rasaad yn Bashir was a Calishite monk of the Order of the Sun Soul. Raised in the order along with his brother Gamaz, he became a determined defender of the faith of Selûne.
Biography of Safana
Safana was a noblewoman from Calimport who ran away to sea to become a pirate in her teens. A keen treasure-hunter, she used all her skills to get what she wanted as often as she could.
Biography of Schael
Schael Corwin was the daughter of an officer of the Flaming Fist. She grew up to follow in her father's footsteps, and rose rapidly through the ranks.
Biography of Shar-Teel

Shar-Teel was the daughter of Flaming Fist officer Angelo Dosan, but she had little love for the organisation herself. She was a rowdy, brawling fighter who would pick fights simply for the sake of besting people she considered beneath her.
Biography of Chardansearavitriol

Chardansearavitriol was a powerful black dragon who was the first to settle in the Mere of Dead Men after the fall of Uthtower. An early convert to the Cult of the Dragon, he became a dracolich and subsequently developed a cult of his own.
Biography of Malkizid

Malkizid was once a solar in the service of the Seldarine. Lolth tempted him into betraying Corellon, who cast him down into Baator. Later banished by Asmodeus as well, he allied with the yugoloths, and now seeks to undermine both surface elves and drow in revenge for his expulsion.
Biography of Soneillon
The demon Soneillon was summoned to Narfell by the ancient Nar demonbinders. She was subsequently responsible for a series of plagues and wars in both Impiltur and Chondath.
Biography of Caelar
Caelar Argent was a member of Waterdeep's nobility, and her family claimed descent from a deity. Always driven by piety and a desire to see evil vanquished, she became a visionary military leader.
Biography of Eltab

Eltab, demon lord of the Hidden Layer, was perhaps the most powerful demon brought to Toril by the demonbinders of Narfell. Trapped in the Material Plane ever since, he was repeatedly imprisoned by other mages, but escaped again to spread destruction.
Biography of Tristan

Tristan Kendrick was the heir of the Kendrick dynasty of Corwell, one of the ancient houses of Moonshae. A keen adventurer in his youth, he regarded statecraft as merely a burden, and preferred to travel and spend time with personal friends.
Biography of Alicia

Alicia Kendrick was the eldest daughter of Tristan Kendrick, High King of Moonshae. An adventurer at heart like her father, she was also blessed by the ancient powers of the Moonshae Isles to confront evil.
Biography of Giogioni

Giogioni Wyvernspur, known as Giogi, was raised by his aunt Dorath, who regarded him as rash and naïve. Despite his natural awkwardness, he was blessed by Selûne with special abilities which served him well in an eventful career.
Biography of Imvaernarhro

Imvaernarhro was one of the greatest red dragons of the North. A master of magic as well as a fearsome predator, he regarded the High Forest and much of the area around it as his personal domain and manipulated its other inhabitants for his own amusement.
Biography of Gorion
Gorion was a retired adventurer who became a respected sage and mentor in the library-fortress of Candlekeep.
Biography of Gut
Gut was a goblin mystic who became the herald and leader of a mysterious religious movement called the Cult of the Absolute, and demonstrated unusual psychic powers.
Biography of Astele

Astele Keene was a woman who grew up in the poor districts of Baldur's Gate, and developed a reputation for cold, calculating behaviour. There were many rumours about the extent of her reach, but few knew her well enough to be sure of her influence in the city's underworld.
Biography of Claugiyliamatar
Claugiyliamatar was an old and patient green dragon who enhanced her hoard by sponsoring criminal enterprises along the Sword Coast. She was notorious for her subtlety and cruel humour.
Biography of Iymrith
Iymrith was a blue dragon of immense antiquity who rose to great power as a sorcerer. Her ability to animate stone gave her the nickname 'the Dragon of the Statues'.
Biography of Rakor
Rakor was a black dragon who allied himself to the Cult of the Dragon, supporting them in their raids against the Uthgardt tribes.
Biography of Sath'fiss'ith
Sath'fiss'ith was a sarrukh magic-user who had lived through many ages and mastered rare magics of sun, wind, and storm.
Biography of Ingeloakastimizilian
The dragon Ingeloakastimizilian, known as Icingdeath, was a terror of the uttermost north of Faerûn, and a rival to generations of Reghedman chiefs.
Biography of Farideh
Farideh was a tiefling adopted into a dragonborn family, who inadvertently became a warlock serving the cambion Lorcan.
Biography of Jarlaxle
Jarlaxle was a drow warrior who became famous as a mercenary leader and adventurer who travelled the length and breadth of Faerûn.
Biography of Yvonnel the Eternal
Matron Mother Yvonnel Baenre was the ruler of Menzoberranzan since before any of her subjects could remember. For centuries, her cruel leadership was an unwavering pillar of the Northdark.
Biography of Gromph
Gromph Baenre was an archmage and educator who achieved a level of power and respect almost unparalleled for a man in Lolthite drow society.
Biography of Triel
Triel Baenre was a famed priestess of the spider-goddess Lolth, noted for her cunning and ambition.
Biography of Quenthel
Quenthel Baenre was a priestess of Lolth who was noted for her physical strength and sour temper.
Biography of Bladen'Kerst
Bladen'Kerst Baenre was a priestess of Lolth who was infamous for her cruelty to those around her, and her disregard for social convention.
Biography of Vendes
Vendes Baenre was a small but ferocious drow priestess whose murderous outbursts earned her the epithet 'Duk-Tak' - the Unholy Executioner.
Biography of Cazador
Cazador Szarr was an elder member of the patriar house of Szarr, who had been mysteriously influential in the politics of Baldur's Gate for centuries.
Biography of Dantrag
Dantrag Baenre was a renowned swordsman in Menzoberranzan, whom many other drow men of the city viewed as a rival to be taken down due to his imposing stature and skill.
Biography of Jeggred
Jeggred Baenre was sired by a tanar'ri demon, and served his mother as a bodyguard and assassin.
Biography of Methil

Methil El-Viddenvelp was an illithid from the subterranean city of Phanlinksal, who served as a political advisor to the rulers of Menzoberranzan, while also pursuing his own distinctive brand of mysticism.
Biography of Liriel
Liriel Baenre was a drow wizard who was made to become a priestess against her own preferences and better judgement.
Biography of Pharaun
Pharaun Mizzrym was a proud and ambitious drow wizard who enjoyed provoking other people's rivalries as an intellectual game.
Biography of Nahaunglaroth
Nahaunglaroth was a blue dragon of the ancient lineage of Morueme, who pioneered the breeding of dragon-hobgoblin hybrids to serve as foot soldiers for the clan.
Biography of Klauth
Klauth was a huge and ancient red dragon who defeated many rival dragons over the years, coming to control an extensive hunting range across the North. §ZKlauth can have Fire Giants as minions.§!
Biography of Artemis
Artemis Entreri came up from a hard life in the slums of Calimshan to become a renowned mercenary and assassin. He was noted for his humourless demeanour and ascetic attitude.
Biography of Vizeran

Vizeran De'Vir was a rival of Gromph Baenre at the Academy in Menzoberranzan. Gromph exposed Vizeran as a worshipper of the Elder Elemental Eye, and Vizeran was exiled from the City of Spiders for life.
Biography of Zaknafein

Zaknafein was weapons master of House Do'Urden, and was house patron for a time until the fickle Matron Malice chose another to fill his position. Within the Underdark, he had a reputation as one of the greatest swordsmen around.
Biography of Malice
Malice Do'Urden murdered her own mother using forbidden magic to become Matron of her house as the relatively young age of 100. She was notorious for her cruelty, as well as for her lustful nature.
Biography of Volo

Volothamp Geddarm, usually known simply as Volo, was an intinerant mage from a poor background who gained fame as the author of a series of guidebooks, including both simple travel guides and the more notorious Volo's Guide to All Things Magical, which was repeatedly censored.
Biography of Malaina
Malaina van Talstiv was a mysterious former adventurer who became the wife of Alustriel Silverhand.
Biography of Dagult
Dagult Neverember was a nobleman and entrepreneur who claimed to be descended from the Alagondar family of Neverwinter.
Biography of Herzgo
Herzgo Alegni was a Shadovar tiefling who became a military leader noted for both skill and cruelty.
Biography of Hedrun

Hedrun Arnsfirth was blessed by Auril with mystical power over snow and ice. When her power first manifested, she accidentally killed the man she had been pledged to marry. The Tribe of the Elk banished her, but Auril protected her and raised her to greater power.
Biography of Bjornhild
Bjornhild Solvigsdottir was the stern and unforgiving queen of the Tribe of the Tiger. Famous for her prowess in battle, she was said by some to have ice-water flowing from her heart.
Biography of Remallia
Remallia 'Remi' Haventree was an elven woman who married into the noble Ulbrinter family of Waterdeep, and became an influential figure in Waterdhavian high society.
Biography of Arveiaturace
Arveiaturace the White Wyrm was a great white dragon of the far north of Faerûn, whose range extended along the north of the Spine of the World and the Sea of Moving Ice.
Biography of Severin
Severin Silrajin was an influential scholar and religious leader whose defiance of cult orthodoxy led him to promote the worship of Tiamat within the Cult of the Dragon.
Biography of Yamun
Yamun Hoekun was an ambitious warlord whose charisma and military skill enabled him to unite first the Tuigan people, and then much of the Endless Wastes of Taan, under his banner.
Biography of Shandril
Shandril Shessair was a barmaid from Deepingdale who discovered that she could wield the rare and dangerous magical energy known as Spellfire.
Biography of Malik el Sami yn Nasser

Malik was originally a merchant from Calimshan, sent as a spy and forced to abandon his family when the Cyrinishad was discovered. Though he failed in retrieving the book, he proved instrumental in saving his own god and was elevated as a Chosen of Cyric.
Biography of Trelasarra
Trelasarra Zuind was a follower of Eilistraee who refounded her goddess' worship in the Waterdeep area with the support of Remallia Haventree.
Biography of Regis
Regis was a halfling who loved to dabble in politics and organised crime. He befriended Drizzt Do'Urden and his companions, and became a frequent participant in their adventures.
Biography of Catti-brie
Catti-brie was an orphaned human girl who was adopted by the dwarven leader Bruenor Battlehammer. She grew up in his care, and got to know his friends, including the drow Drizzt Do'Urden.
Biography of Briennelle Zaharina
Briennelle Zaharina, known as Brie-Zara, was the daughter of the reincarnated Catti-brie and her twice husband, Drizzt Do'Urden. Brie-Zara set out to be a warrior like her parents.
Biography of Acererak

Acererak was born on the distant world of Oerth, to a human mother and a demon father. He turned to necromancy and the path of lichdom, and became the architect of the notorious Tomb of Horrors. He came to Toril in search of further power, and some believed he was even seeking godhood.
Biography of Wulfgar
Wulfgar was a Reghed barbarian of the Tribe of the Elk, who achieved great renown for his strength and reckless bravery.
Biography of Saarvin
Saarvin was a dragonborn from Fireshear in the Cold Run. A proud teller of his own excellence, he adopted the nickname 'King of Frozenfar' to advertise his prowess as a guide and explorer.
Biography of Bayalun

Bayalun was a Tuigan wizard descended from the elven Maraloi of far northeastern Kara-Tur. She was married to two consecutive Khans, and thus became both the stepmother and wife of the legendary Yamun Khahan.
Biography of Valindra

Valindra Shadowmantle was a moon elf wizard whose ambition drove her to study the most forbidden arts of necromancy. A consummate opportunist, she was always watching to see what unsavoury alliance would serve her best in the search for power.
Biography of Vellynne

Vellynne was born into the magically gifted Harpell family of Longsaddle, but did not pursue the Art herself until middle age. She took to her studies very readily, and joined the Hosttower of the Arcane in the pursuit of greater power and knowledge.
Biography of Avarice

The enigmatic tiefling named Avarice was a personal devotees of the archdevil Levistus, and sought to please him with her dedication to destructive magics. Even by the standards of her colleagues at the Hosttower, Avarice was considered to be a ruthless and driven individual.
Biography of Robillard
Robillard was a talented mage who made a name for himself as the first mate of the pirate-hunting vessel Sea Sprite.
Biography of Deudermont

Captain Deudermont was a naval captain who was said to be the greatest pirate hunter of his generation. He commanded a ship called the Sea Sprite, and was renowned for successful actions against pirates along rhe Sword Coast.
Biography of Vaelish
Vaelish Gant was an ambitious Amnian mage who came to Luskan in search of magical knowledge. However, the resources of the Hosttower were not enough for him, and he sought power elsewhere.
Biography of Sammaster

Sammaster was a brilliant but erratic wizard who betrayed the trust of the goddess Mystra and was stripped of his status as her Chosen. Inspired by a questionable translation of 'Chronicle of Years to Come', he came to believe in the future world domination of undead dragons, and founded the Cult of the Dragon to bring it about.
Biography of Tiamat

Tiamat was the immortal queen of chromatic dragons, variously described as a demon, a devil, and a goddess. In Unther, she was portrayed as a beautiful woman with wholly black eyes, or as a dragon with three heads. §ZTiamat can have Chessentan humans as minions.§!
Biography of Tiamat

Tiamat was the goddess of chromatic dragons, a denizen of Avernus in the Nine Hells of Baator since time immemorial. Her favoured avatar took the form of an immense dragon with five heads, one for each of the main kinds of chromatic dragon. §ZTiamat can have Chessentan humans as minions.§!
Biography of Io

Io, also called Asgorath, was the supreme deity of the draconic pantheon, and was said by some to have been the creator of the entire multiverse. Some said that Io had spoken the planes into being with a word, others that Io was dead or sleeping, and the planes were the coils of the deity's incommensurable body.
Biography of Thazienne

Thazienne 'Tazi' Uskevren was the only legitimate daughter of her noble father. After a series of unexpected encounters in her native Sembia, she became a travelling adventurer, crossing the paths of many power-hungry adversaries around the Sea of Fallen Stars.
Biography of Kinnuki

Kinnuki was the last chief of the Reghed Tribe of the White Bear. His lands were seized by the envious necromancer Damnen Morienus, who slew Kinnuki's wife and child. Gifted with unusual youth and vigour, the exiled chief wandered the tundra for many years after his tribe was scattered.
Biography of Aarin

A former slave and pirate, Aarin Gend found success and prestige as spymaster to Nasher Alagondar, the respected lord of Neverwinter. Fiercely loyal, his commitment to people and causes he cared about would lead him into conflict.
Biography of Iryklathagra

The great blue dragon Iryklathagra was born in Anauroch, but laired for many years in Calimshan and Tethyr. She amassed a legendary hoard of magical treasure, and made many powerful enemies, including two Shoon qysars.
Biography of Tchazzar

Tchazzar was a famed warrior-hero of Chessenta who successfully united the city-states and threw off the dominion of Unther. He established a cult of his own worship and was deified after his disappearance in battle. He was subsequently revealed to have been a mighty dragon in disguise, which did nothing to diminish his renown. §ZTchazzar can have Chessentan humans as minions.§!
Biography of Zhengyi

Zhengyi the Witch-King was one of the founders of the Red Wizards of Thay. He later became a devotee of the demon lord Orcus, and achieved lichdom. He broke from the Red Wizards and set about establishing his own tyrannical rule in Vaasa.
Biography of Ghaunadaur

Ghaunadaur was an ancient abyssal deity of slimes and oozes, who for a time was accepted by the Dark Seldarine of Lolth as a member of their pantheon. Malignant, patient, and incomprehensible to mortals, Ghaunadaur sometimes sent his avatar to the material plane for his own dark purposes.
Biography of Jaluth

Jaluth Alaerth was an ambitious and opportunistic wizard who was continually seeking chances to enhance her personal power. Earlier in her career, she was cursed that whenever she became angry or upset, snakes would spill from her face.
Biography of Malabog
Malabog was a mighty king of the Fomorian giants of the Feywild. He envied the elves of Sharandar, and sought to extend his domain onto the Material Plane in order to displace them.
Biography of Cadderly

Cadderly was the son of the wizard Aballister Bonaduce, who abandoned him to be raised at the Edificant Library. After confronting his father's evil ambitions, Cadderly embraced his destiny as a Chosen of the god Deneir.
Biography of Szass Tam

Szass Tam was a Red Wizard of Thay and a proficient necromancer who overthrew his predecessor Nyressa Flass to become Zulkir of Necromancy. A talented scholar and a patient schemer, he was famed for his many intricate plots for the glory of Thay and his own advancement.
Biography of Errtu

Errtu was one of most powerful among the balors, commanders of the demonic tanar'ri. Although he ruled an entire layer of the Abyss, his greed for the enchanted crystal Crenshinibon led him to return time and again to Toril and the schemes of the drow.
Biography of Penelope

Penelope Harpell was the matriarch of the magically-gifted ruling family of Longsaddle in the late 15th century of the Dalereckoning. She was a renowned teacher of magic, and a dedicated defender of her home town.
Biography of Zalto

Zalto was a mighty fire giant warrior who considered himself the natural leader of all fire giants in Faerûn. Although combat was his greatest passion, he was also a skilled diplomat and a scholar of ancient engineering.
Biography of Dispater

The archdevil Dispater was ruler of Dis, the Second Hell of Baator, which he governed from the security of the Iron City. He was an endlessly calculating and manipulative fiend, who viewed politics as a complex game of which he was the true master.
Biography of Glasya

Glasya was the daughter of Asmodeus, lord of the Nine Hells of Baator. As an archdevil in her own right, she ruled over Malbolge, the Sixth Hell. Some believed her father had given her this responsibility to burden her and rein in her excesses.
Biography of Baalzebul

Baalzebul, the ruler of Maladomini, the Seventh Hell of Baator, was long ago a powerful and beautiful archon called Triel. He abandoned his celestial post and joined forces with Asmodeus, but the Lord of the Ninth later cursed him with the form of a monstrous slug for some subtle betrayal.
Biography of Baphomet
Baphomet was a demon lord of great antiquity and power, who personified bestial rage and cruelty. He was a favourite patron of minotaurs, but he retained a great and envious rivalry with Yeenoghu.
Biography of Auril
Auril the Frostmaiden was the goddess of winter and cold. At times she served Silvanus as a nature deity, but more often her allegiance was to Talos as a force of destruction.
Biography of Garagos
Garagos the Reaver, known in ancient Netheril as Targus, was a god of wild combat and indiscriminate bloodshed. In later times, he was largely eclipsed by other, more popular war-gods.
Biography of Aoth

Aoth Fezim was the commander of Thay's Griffon Legion. After the Thayan Civil War and the scourge of the Spellplague, Aoth took the Legion independent as the Brotherhood of the Griffon, working as a mercenary around the Inner Sea.
Biography of Kaanyr

Kaanyr Vhok was a cambion who rose to prominence during the long reign of the tanar'ri of the Scoured Legion over Hellgate Keep, in the ruins of Ascalhorn. Ruthlessly ambitious, there was no-one he was not willing to betray to secure his own advancement.
Biography of Rezmir

Rezmir was a half-dragon warrior descended from the ancient black dragons of the House of Orogoth. Her personal devotion to Tiamat led her to join the Cult of the Dragon, and join in its reformation towards the worship of the Dragon Queen.
Biography of Hydia

Hydia Moonmusk was the daughter of a respected clan chief of the revived Blue Bear Uthgardt tribe. But unlike her more steady mother, Hydia harboured a vigorous hatred for settled life and all its trappings, and sought out powerful allies in order to make war on the city-dwellers.
Biography of Kayalithica

Kayalithica was a stone giant who rose to be a mighty thane among her people. She coldly despised the work of the settled smaller folk, and longed for a world in which there would be no more cities, but only the giants and their art.
Biography of Danilo
Danila Thann was born into one of Waterdeep's most respected noble families. He had a public reputation as a fop and a fool, although his magical capacity was also apparent.
Biography of Arilyn

Arilyn Moonblade was an elven assassin who took her name from the magical elven heirloom sword she wielded. Her allegiances changed over time, as she came to understand her own heritage and identity better.
Biography of Elaith

Elaith Craulnobur was an elven noble who lived in exile in Waterdeep, where he built a reputation as a mercenary, assassin, and crime lord. His wicked exploits were the subject of a popular ballad, 'Silent Strikes the Serpent'.
Biography of Mirt

Mirt 'the Moneylender' was a businessman and retired adventurer in Waterdeep. Formerly nicknamed 'the Merciless' he was one of the first independent adventurers to make a fortune braving the dangers of Undermountain, and he was a close associate of Durnan 'the Wanderer', whose reputation was likewise tied to the dungeons below the city.
Biography of Sansuri
Sansuri was the self-appointed leader of Faerûn's cloud giants. In her quest to elevate her people to greatness, she gave in to the temptations of cruelty and power.
Biography of Storvald
Storvald was the would-be ruler of all frost giants. He sought to bring an ice age to Toril in order to ensure the dominion of his people over all others.
Biography of Hekaton
Hekaton was the Storm King, the titular leader of the storm giants, and thus of all the giants of the Ordning. He was a stern and serious ruler with little time for smaller peoples.
Biography of Neri
Neri was the queen of the storm giants. She was much more interested than most other giants in the affairs of the smaller folk of Faerûn, and took time to visit them and learn about their ways.
Biography of Valamaradace

Valamaradace was a mighty gold dragon who laired in a large earthmote near Everlund, which she gained for her kindness to the dying red dragon Mairogra. She was known as the Dragon Queen of Silverymoon, or the Wyrm Regent of the North.
Biography of Erevis
Erevis Cale was a professional rogue with many shifting loyalties and associations, who experienced a growing personal connection to Mask, the god of thieves.
Biography of Arietta
Arietta Seasilver was a Cormyrean noblewoman who became a vessel for the power of Siamorphe, goddess of nobility and duty.
Biography of Isteval

Sir Isteval was a retired officer of Cormyr's army, the Purple Dragons, who had led adventuring parties and battled several dragons. He continued to be a sponsor of adventurers, and to promote what he was as Cormyrean virtues.
Biography of Kleef
Kleef Kenric was a watch officer from Marsember in Cormyr, who was marked for service by his god, Helm. He was renowned for his steadfastness and honesty.
Biography of Firkraag
'Lord Jierdan Firkraag' turned out to be a red dragon who disguised himself as a human to pursue political intrigues and vendettas, and to further enrich himself.
Biography of Belaphoss

Belaphoss was the Abyssal Lord Demogorgon's leading general, a balor who commanded innumerable hordes of demons in conflicts with other lords of the Abyss, as well as with devils and mortals whenever the opportunity arose. Selfish and ambitious, he encouraged those traits in others as long as they did not threaten his own power.
Biography of Thamalon
Thamalon Uskevren the Elder was the patriarch of the Sembite noble house of Uskevren of Selgaunt. A merchant and statesman, he was noted for his interests in literature and fine wines.
Biography of Ellesime

Ellesime was the elven queen of Suldanessellar, in Wealdath. She was renowned for her timeless beauty, even by elven standards. Some attributed it to divine heritage, and others to her mystical relationship to her city's sacred Tree of Life.
Biography of Chuth
Chuth was a green dragon who had laired for many years around the Misty Forest. He had a particular taste for the flesh of elven nobles, but that craving might lead him to make an unlikely alliance.
Biography of Neronvain
Neronvain was a prince of the elven realm of Narivaemista. He clashed repeatedly with his father the king, and was eventually exiled.
Biography of Alusair Nacacia

Alusair Nacacia Obarskyr was the younger daughter of Azoun IV of Cormyr. A famously strong-willed woman, she was often away pursuing adventures and intrigues of her own, but would return to defend her realm when it most needed her.
Biography of Min Ho

Batu Min Ho was a soldier from Chukei in Shou Lung who worked his way up through the ranks of the imperial army. Entrusted with a position of high command, he was able to make the marriage he had aspired to.
Biography of Nung Chiang

Nung Chiang, sometimes called the Teacher of the Plough, was one of the Nine Immortals, divine servants of the Celestial Emperor sent to Toril to spread the word of the Path. He sometimes appeared as a humble old man, but was also fond of the form of a vast celestial dragon.
Biography of Rynnarvyx
Rynnarvyx was a fiendish white dragon, spawned in the outer-planar realm of Auril the Frostmaiden. He was sent to Toril to support the growing power of the frost giants in the north of Faerûn.
Biography of Uresgol

Uresgol was a mind flayer elder brain from the Far Realm, who was part of the alien force that occupied the Abeiran dragonborn city of Xorvintroth. Before that city was drawn to Toril by the Spellplague, Uresgol took over the body of the amethyst dragon Amaranthraxine. The combined elder brain dragon became one of the great powers of the lost city.
Biography of Taern

Taern Hornblade, nicknamed 'Thunderspell', was the founder of the defensive force known as the Spellguard of Silverymoon. A flamboyant spellcaster in his youth, he matured to be a patient and loyal politician.
Biography of Hsuang Wu Yu

Hsuang Yu Wu was the daughter of a local ruler in Shou Lung's Chukei province. Strong-willed like her father, she married one of his most promising officers, but unwittingly made enemies as she rose to prominence.
Biography of Ting Mei Wan

Ting Mei Wan was a senior figure in the Shou mandarinate during the Gathering of the Pearls. She was a forceful leader in the imperial security service, known for her ruthless treatment of enemies and failing underlings alike.
Biography of Kai Tsao Shou

Kai Tsao Shou was the son of the Hsiao Emperor of Shou Lung. The regnal name that he adopted when he became emperor carried the meaning of 'reformer', and he established a centralising political programme called the Gathering of the Pearls.
Biography of Protanther

Protanther was a gold dragon who was regarded as a respected leader by other metallic dragons. He usually disliked and avoided humanoid species, regarding them as the architects not only of their own misfortune, but also of many wider evils in the world. §ZProtanther can have Arctic Dwarves as minions.§!
Biography of Lareth
Lareth was reputed to be one of the most powerful gold dragons in the world. He was famed for his dignity and perception, and respected by other gold dragons.
Biography of Tamarand

Tamarand was a gold dragon who was friendly to non-dragons. Unusually for a dragon, he had made a particular study of the customs and societies of humanoids. §ZTamarand can have Shield Dwarves or Storm Giants as minions.§!
Biography of Blizzard
Blizzard was the estranged daughter of Maalthiir, the lord of Hillsfar. As soon as she was able, she allied herself with those seeking her father's downfall.
Biography of Gerti Orelsdottir
Gerti Orelsdottir was a frost giant princess who dedicated herself to the service of the goddess Auril the Frostmaiden.
Biography of Aeron
Aeron Morieth was a half-elven orphan from Maerchlin in Chessenta, who showed unusual talent in the rare art of Shadow Magic. For this, he attracted the unwanted interest of Shar, the Lady of Loss.
Biography of Abu Bakr

Abu Bakr was the eldest son of the renowned Lion of Semphar. On coming to the throne, he believed himself set for a reign as glorious as his father's, but his own talents and capricious fate set him on a different path.
Biography of Jarir

Jarir ar-Rabi was a notoriously cruel and fickle bandit warlord of the Raurin Desert. He was said to have sacrificed half a finger for secret arcane knowledge, but those who crossed him often lost much more.
Biography of Chanar Ong Kho
Chanar Ong Kho was a leading khan among the Naican people. He was rewarded for his outstanding command skills by his liege, Yamun Khahan.
Biography of Koja
Koja was a lama at the Red Mountain Temple in Khazari. Trusted by the ruling prince of Khazari, Koja became a widely-travelled diplomat.
Biography of Tsenya Garbo
Tsenya Garbo was the ruling lama of Ra-Khati, and spiritual leader of Toril's Padhran community. He was a selfless man, who put his nation and his faithful first, even at the cost of wiser decisions.
Biography of Tsenya Bhrokiti

Tsenya Bhrokiti was the wilful and quick-tempered daughter of the lama of Ra-Khati. Unlike many of her kinfolk, she was very interested in the world beyond the mountains of Katakoro, and was willing to take risks in order to travel and broaden her horizons.
Biography of Ogandi

Prince Ogandi was the official ruler of the mountainous realm of Khazari. However, at the start of his reign his power was sorely limited by his many squabbling vassals, whom he sought to bring into line.
Biography of Torg mac Cei
Torg mac Cei was the venerable dwarven king of Earthfast. He was somewhat reclusive, but was able to rise to a challenge when his homeland was threatened.
Biography of Hubadai
Hubadai was the son of Yamun Khahan, the famed Tuigan warlord of the Endless Steppe. Like his father, Hubadai was a skilled commander, capable of both insight and ruthlessness on the field of battle.
Biography of Markos
Markos Silverhammer was the king of the Siremun dwarves, who lived in the Firepeaks range. Beset by feuding clans within his realm, he exploited any opportunity to force them to work together.
Biography of the King of Shadows

The King of Shadows was once a human magic-user recruited to defend the realm of Illefarn against the orcs and the Netherese. Transformed into an immortal construct for this purpose, the King was turned to the service of the dark gods by a series of disasters.
Biography of Garius
Black Garius was an archmage who sought power and immortality for himself. Exploiting a series of allies in turn, he unleashed a force even he could not master.
Biography of Myrkul

Myrkul Bey al-Kursi was a mortal necromancer from ancient Murghôm who, along with his adventuring companions Bane and Bhaal, won the divine portfolios of Jergal, Lord of the End of Everything. Myrkul chose to become the god of death, ruling from the Bone Castle on the Grey Waste.
Biography of Ariel
Ariel Manx was a merchant's daughter from Deepingdale who experienced special favour from Mystra, goddess of magic. She left home and began studying in the goddess' temple.
Biography of Midnight

After the Time of Troubles, the mantle of the goddess Mystra, Lady of Mysteries, was taken on by the mortal Midnight, who had once been called Ariel Manx. She thus became part of the deity's cycle of cosmic rebirth.
Biography of Bane

Bane was once a mortal human who challenged the god Jergal, Lord of the End of Everything. Along with his adventuring companions Bhaal and Myrkul, he triumphed and was granted divinity as the god of tyranny and strife.
Biography of Iyachtu Xvim
Iyachtu Xvim was the demigod son of the evil deity Bane and an unknown mother. He came frequently to Toril to spread his personal brand of hatred and tyranny.
Biography of Azuth
Azuth was a mortal mage who became the first Magister of Mystra. After his mortal service, she raised him to divinity as the god of wizards, who acted as the chief among her many servitors.
Biography of Lysan
Lysan was a devotee of Auril the Frostmaiden, who insinuated her way into the isolated community of Kuldahar in order to fulfil the secret purposes of her goddess.
Biography of Voss
Voss Anderton was a public servant from Neverwinter, who dutifully served on the Absolution Council of Revel's End prison.
Biography of Jil
Jil Torbo was a patriar from Baldur's Gate who begrudgingly served on the Absolution Council of Revel's End prison.
Biography of Jarnathan
Jarnathan was an aarakocra who served on the Absolution Council of Revel's End prison. He had a particular reputation for mercy towards the prison's inmates when reviewing their cases.
Biography of Gandalug
Gandalug Battlehammer was the first king of Mithral Hall. After abdicating in favour of his son, he went adventuring, and was magically imprisoned for many long years by Matron Mother Yvonnel Baenre.
Biography of Havilar
Havilar was a tiefling adopted into a dragonborn family, who accidentally summoned a cambion, leading to her sister becoming a warlock. Havilar herself became a bounty hunter not long after.
Biography of Scyllua
Scyllua Darkhope was enslaved as a child and brought to Zhentil Keep. As a teenager, she joined the city's army in the hope of reforming it, but found herself ensnared in its corruption.
Biography of Voaraghamanthar
Voaraghamanthar was a black dragon who sought the secret of immortality, along with his twin brother Waervaerendor.
Biography of Waervaerendor
Waervaerendor was a black dragon who sought the secret of immortality, along with his twin brother Voaraghamanthar.
Biography of Moander

Moander was an ancient deity of rot, corruption and decay. The Darkbringer never had a large following, but was worshipped since before the rise of Netheril. Moander was also notable for appearing with varying genders in their many appearances. Moander was a cruel and controlling tyrant, relishing in tormenting and destroying mortals.
Biography of Thauglorimorgorus

Thauglorimorgorus the Black Doom was a mighty black dragon, so ancient that his scales had turned to a deep purple colour. He ruled a large portion of what was later Cormyr, giving rise to its name as the Land of the Purple Dragon.
Biography of Foril
Foril Obarskyr was the son of the reforming king Azoun V of Cormyr. He ruled for many years, resisting calls for his abdication as he grew older.
Biography of Filfaeril
Filfaeril Selazair was a famed society beauty of the Cormyrean court at Suzail. She enjoyed the respect and admiration of many in the Forest Kingdom.
Biography of Zaranda

Zaranda Star was an adventurer and mercenary leader who served in the war against the Tuigan Horde, before purchasing a noble title in war-torn Tethyr. This was the start of her rise to greater prominence.
Biography of Arauthator
Arauthator was a patient and fiercely territorial white dragon, who long sought revenge of Tulrun of the Tent for the slaughter of his family.
Biography of Mistinarperadnacles

Mistinarperadnacles Hai Draco, known as Mist for short, was an eccentric red dragon who did not take joy in causing terror, but preferred music and stories. She laired in the mountains on the western border of Cormyr.
Biography of Havarlan
Havarlan was a mighty silver dragon who dedicated herself to the service of the god Bahamut, whom she called Xymor. She was a loyal ally of Bahamut's other champions in Faerûn.
Biography of Tanalasta
Tanalasta was the eldest daughter of Azoun IV of Cormyr and his wife Filfaeril. She was a respected and well-liked member of the royal court.
Biography of Forfallen
Forfallen was a princess of Norland who fell prey to a magical curse and forsook her birthright to become a mighty pirate.
Biography of Karas
Karas was raised by her family in Waterdeep, but when she learned that she was a distant cousin of Bane's champion Fzoul Chembryl, she ran way to make a new life for herself.
Biography of Biha
Biha Babir was a leader among the marid genies of Calimshan, known for her imposing presence, magical skill, and far-reaching network of informants.
Biography of Caitlyn

Caitlyn Kendrick was the granddaughter of both King Derid of Moonshae and High Lady Ordalf of the LeShay, and her parents' union was a sign of new peace between their peoples. But although she was the heir to both kingdoms, Caitlyn avoided the duties of court, preferring to travel alone, even when young.
Biography of Markham
Markham Southwell was a militia commander in Icewind Dale. He was a stern man who didn't show emotion readily, but held fast in protecting his community.
Biography of Rora
Rora Rudiland was a follower of Tyr from the Abbey of the Just Hammer. She was a famed swordswoman, and earned respect and a position of leadership in her native Tasseldale.
Biography of Volsembra

Volsembra was a mysterious dragonborn knight who sought to rebuild the town of Essembra in Battledale. She always refused to admit any connection to the dragon Essembra who had founded it centuries before.
Biography of Songal
Songal was the daughter of the first Syl-Pasha of Calimshan after the Second Era of Skyfire. A talented wizard, she was the inventor of several spells and a patron to other practitioners of the Art.
Biography of Deryan

Deryan Kaya was renowned as one of the greatest artificers of her age, the creator of numerous ingenious constructs and magical tools. She learned from Lantanese crafters and added her own expertise to devise new wonders.
Biography of Ordalf

High Lady Ordalf was the ruler of the ancient fey LeShay people in Moonshae, and in exile in the Feywild. After nearly two millennia in the land of Faerie, she returned her kingdom to the mortal plane, causing great upheaval.
Biography of Malar
Malar the Beastlord was a primal deity of hunting and bloodlust. He taught his followers to follow their instincts and give in to the pleasure of the kill.
Biography of the Eldest

The Eldest was an enormous aboleth, unthinkably old compared to all beings native to Toril. It dwelled in the heart of the mystical city of Xxiphu, from where it laid deep and terrible plans to subjugate all life.
Biography of Araithe
Prince Araithe was the son and sometime lover of Lady Ordalf, leader of the ancient LeShay, fey elves from a remote era of history.
Biography of Robyn
Robyn Moonsinger was an hereditary druid of the old faith of the Moonshae Isles, although she only discovered her powers by accident in a moment of stress.
Biography of Brandon
Brandon Olafsson was a charismatic leader among the Northlander peoples of the Moonshae Isles, able to convince his fellow chiefs to look beyond their immediate desires and think of the future.
Biography of Aurora
Aurora of Waterdeep was a wizard and entrepreneur who used her magic and her keen business acumen to create a company which operated a magically-connected chain of shops in major cities.
Biography of Aurora
Aurora was the great-granddaughter of her namesake, the founder of Aurora's Emporiums. She worked to bring the business back to its former success after a century of upheavals.
Biography of Gark

Great Gark was the ruler of the Feywild goblin realm of Nachtur, which intruded into the Material Plane in Dernall Forest, on the Isle of Alaron. He saw himself as a civilising influence on other goblinkind, but was nonetheless an avid raider.
Biography of Kelson

Kelson was a half-elven grandson of respected elven leader Lord Elorfindar Floshin. Kelson sought to prove himself to his elven relatives, and rose to a position of trust under the Dukes of Daggerford.
Biography of Shalendra
Shalendra Floshin was a proud scion of an ancient elven house. She was brave and serious, and ready to risk anything in the service of elvenkind.
Biography of Darfin

Sir Darfin Floshin was the son and heir of Lord Elorfindar Floshin, a famed member of an ancient elven family. Darfin felt himself duty-bound to support his father and his commitment to Ardeep Forest and its surroundings.
Biography of Zaltember
Zaltember was the son of the great fire giant duke, Zalto. He was a cruel and petty bully who liked to throw his considerable weight around in tormenting opponents and victimising underlings.
Biography of Isarr
Isarr Kronenstrom was a wild and vicious leader of the Reghed Tribe of the Wolf. Dedicated to Malar, Lord of the Hunt, Isarr cultivated a reputation for bloodlust and ferocity.
Biography of Kimmuriel
Kimmuriel Oblodra was a powerful psychic from Menzoberranzan who was noted for his dour demeanour and slowness to trust others.
Biography of Hazaufein
Hazaufein Oblodra was elderboy and house wizard in a family dominated by psions. He bore the resulting devaluing of his position with uncommon patience by the standards of Lolthite drow.
Biography of Quavylene

Quavylene Oblodra was the leading priestess of her house, but she lacked the characteristic confidence and drive of other high priestesses of Lolth owing to decades of psychological abuse from her mother.
Biography of K'yorl Odran

K'yorl Odran Oblodra was for many years the ruling Matron Mother of House Oblodra, a leading drow faction in Menzoberranzan which was renowned for its mastery of the Invisible Art of psionics. A physically slight woman, she more than compensated for her size with formidable mental power and seemingly endless capacity for personal cruelty.
Biography of Tsabanor
Tsabanor was a commoner of House Oblodra who was elevated to the role of Patron by Matron Mother K'yorl. She abused him viciously, breaking his spirit over an extended period.
Biography of Drizfryn

Drizfryn Oblodra was the weapon master of his house, and was known in Menzoberranzan to be a man capable of unbridled violence that was kept in check only by the authority of his mother, Matron Mother K'yorl.
Biography of Dinin
Dinin Do'Urden was a son of Matron Mother Malice, whose cynicism and ambition fitted him well for the career of a drow warrior.
Biography of Vierna
Vierna Do'Urden was a priestess of Lolth in Menzoberranzan, whose attitude to the world and her family was shaped by the cruelty of her mother, Matron Mother Malice.
Biography of Briza

Briza Do'Urden was the eldest child of Matron Mother Malice, who used her birth to power a ritual that killed her own mother, Vartha. A strong and callous woman, she was well-suited to her role as priestess of Lolth.
Biography of Maya
Maya Do'Urden was a junior priestess of Lolth in Menzoberranzan. Her slender frame belied a considerable amount of physical strength, which she put to cruel use.
Biography of Rizzen

Rizzen was a common drow of House Do'Urden whose good looks led to his selection to be the new patron of Matron Mother Malice. Although she found him entertaining, she was frequently cruel to him and had no deep positive feeling towards him.
Biography of Tiago

Tiago Baenre was a drow warrior from Menzoberranzan's notorious ruling house. Although men were disfavoured in Lolthite society, his family name, good looks and skill at arms earned Tiago a significant reputation.
Biography of Sos'Umptu
Sos'Umptu Baenre was a devoted priestess of Lolth. Lacking the ambition of her sisters, she was satisfied with keeping her family's chapel, and steadily working to enhance its glory.
Biography of Myrineyl
Myrineyl Baenre was an ambitious and sadistic priestess of Lolth. Unlike other drow, she had a special fascination with surface elves, but her treatment of them was always callous and exploitative.
Biography of Aumon
Aumon Baenre was the eldest son of Quenthel Baenre. Although this gave him a relatively safe position for a drow man, he was dissatisfied and disillusioned with it.
Biography of Sheila

Sheila was a plane-walking adventurer who had been drawn into another world as a teenager. A skilled thief, she strove to protect her friends and family in the many strange places their adventures brought them to.
Biography of Hank

Hank was a teenager from another world when he was drawn unwillingly into a life of plane-travelling adventure. The eldest among his companions and a natural leader, he sought to guide his party with respect and confidence.
Biography of Eric
Eric was a proud and serious adventurer who had been pulled into a life of planar travel against his will. He was often sceptical of his friends' plans, and faced their criticism when he spoke out.
Biography of Bobby

Bobby was just a small child when he was snatched from his home by magic and launched onto a series of interplanar adventures. He was an impulsive man who would sometimes lash out for fear of being thought weak.
Biography of Diana

Diana was a teenager on a distant world when she was thrust unexpectedly into a succession of adventures across the planes. She cultivated the discipline of a monk, and learned to be patient with those around her in many trying situations.
Biography of Presto

Originally an aspiring stage magician from another world, Presto was carried away unwillingly to a lifetime of plane-hopping adventure. In the course of his travels, he developed a true flair for the Art, gradually becoming an accomplished wizard.
Biography of Niko

Niko was a student from another world who found herself unexpectedly adrift in an unfamiliar realm. Discovering that her faith gave her mystical powers in her new home, she eventually made contact with a group of adventurers from her homeworld who were able to help her.
Biography of Akar
Akar Kessell was an ambitious Luskanite wizard whose search for power led him to make a series of dangerous bargains. A greedy and weak-minded man, he was easily led into poor decisions.
Biography of Dahlia

Dahlia Sin'felle was an elven warrior who responded to the trauma of her early life by becoming hardened and cruel in return. She willingly entered the service of the Red Wizards of Thay in order to avenge herself on the Shadovar who violated her and killed her mother.
Biography of Obould

Obould the Seventeenth was a proud scion of the dynasty which had established the Kingdom of Many-Arrows, the new triumph of orcish civilisation in northern Faerûn. A firm but ruthless ruler, he was quick to execute insubordinate underlings.
Biography of Liara

Liara Portyr was a patriar dynast of the Baldurian house of Portyr, and an officer in the Flaming Fist. A merciless and uncompromising woman, she believed that social order could be achieved through discipline and fear.
Biography of Thalamra
